verses.kjv: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, unto the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in all Achaia:
verses.web: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, and Timothy our brother, to the assembly of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints who are in the whole of Achaia:
verses.ct: From Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and from Timothy our brother — to the church of God in Corinth, along with all the saints throughout Achaia:

verses.kjv: Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.web: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: May grace and peace be yours from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;
verses.web: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort;
verses.ct: Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! He is the Father of mercy and the God of all comfort.

verses.kjv: Who comforteth us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble, by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.
verses.web: who comforts us in all our affliction, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any affliction, through the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.
verses.ct: He comforts us in every hardship we face, so that we can comfort others going through any kind of trouble — using the same comfort God has given us.

verses.kjv: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also aboundeth by Christ.
verses.web: For as the sufferings of Christ abound to us, even so our comfort also abounds through Christ.
verses.ct: The more we share in the sufferings of Christ, the more his comfort overflows into our lives.

verses.kjv: And whether we be afflicted, it is for your consolation and salvation, which is effectual in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted, it is for your consolation and salvation.
verses.web: But if we are afflicted, it is for your comfort and salvation. If we are comforted, it is for your comfort, which produces in you the patient enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer.
verses.ct: When we suffer, it's for your comfort and salvation — and that salvation proves its power as you endure the same kinds of suffering we go through. When we're comforted, that's for your comfort and salvation too.

verses.kjv: And our hope of you is stedfast, knowing, that as ye are partakers of the sufferings, so shall ye be also of the consolation.
verses.web: Our hope for you is steadfast, knowing that, since you are partakers of the sufferings, so you are also of the comfort.
verses.ct: Our hope for you is rock-solid, because we know that just as you share in our sufferings, you'll also share in our comfort.

verses.kjv: For we would not, brethren, have you ignorant of our trouble which came to us in Asia, that we were pressed out of measure, above strength, insomuch that we despaired even of life:
verses.web: For we don’t desire to have you uninformed, brothers, concerning our affliction which happened to us in Asia, that we were weighed down exceedingly, beyond our power, so much that we despaired even of life.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, we want you to know about the hardship we faced in Asia. We were crushed beyond what we could bear — so completely overwhelmed that we didn't think we'd survive.

verses.kjv: But we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God which raiseth the dead:
verses.web: Yes, we ourselves have had the sentence of death within ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God who raises the dead,
verses.ct: In fact, we felt like we'd already been handed a death sentence. But this happened so we would stop relying on ourselves and start trusting in God, who raises the dead.

verses.kjv: Who delivered us from so great a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver us;
verses.web: who delivered us out of so great a death, and does deliver; on whom we have set our hope that he will also still deliver us;
verses.ct: He rescued us from a deadly threat, and he continues to rescue us. We've placed our hope in him that he will keep rescuing us in the future.

verses.kjv: Ye also helping together by prayer for us, that for the gift bestowed upon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.
verses.web: you also helping together on our behalf by your supplication; that, for the gift given to us by means of many, thanks may be given by many persons on your behalf.
verses.ct: And you're helping us by praying for us! That way, when God answers the prayers of so many people on our behalf, many will give thanks to him for the gift he's given us.

verses.kjv: For our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world, and more abundantly to you-ward.
verses.web: For our boasting is this: the testimony of our conscience, that in holiness and sincerity of God, not in fleshly wisdom but in the grace of God we behaved ourselves in the world, and more abundantly toward you.
verses.ct: Here's what we're proud of, and our conscience backs it up: we've conducted ourselves in this world — and especially toward you — with the holiness and sincerity that come from God, not with human cleverness, but through God's grace.

verses.kjv: For we write none other things unto you, than what ye read or acknowledge; and I trust ye shall acknowledge even to the end;
verses.web: For we write no other things to you than what you read or even acknowledge, and I hope you will acknowledge to the end,
verses.ct: We aren't writing anything to you that you can't read and understand. I'm confident you'll fully grasp what we mean,

verses.kjv: As also ye have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.
verses.web: as also you acknowledged us in part, that we are your boasting, even as you also are ours, in the day of our Lord Jesus.
verses.ct: just as you've already partly understood that we are your reason to be proud, and you are ours — on the day of the Lord Jesus.

verses.kjv: And in this confidence I was minded to come unto you before, that ye might have a second benefit;
verses.web: In this confidence, I was determined to come first to you, that you might have a second benefit,
verses.ct: With that confidence, I originally planned to visit you first so you could benefit from seeing me twice.

verses.kjv: And to pass by you into Macedonia, and to come again out of Macedonia unto you, and of you to be brought on my way toward Judaea.
verses.web: and by you to pass into Macedonia, and again from Macedonia to come to you, and to be sent forward by you on my journey to Judea.
verses.ct: My plan was to visit you on my way to Macedonia, then come back to you from Macedonia, and have you send me on my way to Judaea.

verses.kjv: When I therefore was thus minded, did I use lightness? or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be yea yea, and nay nay?
verses.web: When I therefore was thus determined, did I show fickleness? Or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be the “Yes, yes” and the “No, no?”
verses.ct: So when I made those plans, was I being flippant about it? Do I make my decisions the way the world does — saying 'Yes, yes' and 'No, no' at the same time?

verses.kjv: But as God is true, our word toward you was not yea and nay.
verses.web: But as God is faithful, our word toward you was not “Yes and no.”
verses.ct: As surely as God is faithful, our message to you has never been 'yes' and 'no' at the same time.

verses.kjv: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, even by me and Silvanus and Timotheus, was not yea and nay, but in him was yea.
verses.web: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, by me, Silvanus, and Timothy, was not “Yes and no,” but in him is “Yes.”
verses.ct: The Son of God, Jesus Christ — the one Silvanus, Timothy, and I proclaimed to you — was never 'yes' and 'no.' In him, it has always been 'Yes.'

verses.kjv: For all the promises of God in him are yea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.
verses.web: For however many are the promises of God, in him is the “Yes.” Therefore also through him is the “Amen”, to the glory of God through us.
verses.ct: Every single promise God has ever made finds its 'Yes' in Christ. That's why we say 'Amen' through him, bringing glory to God.

verses.kjv: Now he which stablisheth us with you in Christ, and hath anointed us, is God;
verses.web: Now he who establishes us with you in Christ and anointed us is God,
verses.ct: It is God who makes both us and you stand firm in Christ. He is the one who anointed us,

verses.kjv: Who hath also sealed us, and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.
verses.web: who also sealed us, and gave us the down payment of the Spirit in our hearts.
verses.ct: placed his seal of ownership on us, and put his Holy Spirit in our hearts as a guarantee of what's to come.

verses.kjv: Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul, that to spare you I came not as yet unto Corinth.
verses.web: But I call God for a witness to my soul, that I didn’t come to Corinth to spare you.
verses.ct: I call God as my witness — I stake my soul on it — the reason I haven't come to Corinth yet is that I wanted to spare you.

verses.kjv: Not for that we have dominion over your faith, but are helpers of your joy: for by faith ye stand.
verses.web: We don’t control your faith, but are fellow workers with you for your joy. For you stand firm in faith.
verses.ct: We're not trying to control your faith. Instead, we're working alongside you for your joy, because you already stand firm in faith.
